name: Tirathgarh Waterfalls
description: A majestic cascade located inside Kanger Valley National Park, ideal for photography and nature walks.

name: Kutumsar Caves
description: Kutumsar Caves

name: Mahant Ghasidas Memorial Museum
description: A museum preserving ancient relics, tribal artifacts, and archaeological finds from across Chhattisgarh.

name: Kanger Valley National Park
description: A rich biodiverse forest reserve featuring caves, waterfalls, and a wide range of flora and fauna including Bastar hill myna.

name: Pragyagiri Hill
description: A Buddhist site with a huge Buddha statue atop a hill, known for its spiritual aura and panoramic views.

name: Chitrakooth Waterfall
description: Known as the 'Niagara Falls of India', this wide horseshoe-shaped waterfall on the Indravati River is a breathtaking sight, especially during the monsoon.

name: Danteshwari Temple
description: One of the 52 Shakti Peethas of India, this ancient temple in Dantewada is deeply revered and historically significant.

name: Maa Bamleshwari Temple
description: Situated on a hilltop about 1600 feet high, it's the most revered shrine in Dongargarh, attracting thousands of pilgrims year-round.

name: Chhoti Bamleshwari Mata Rani Temple
description: Chhoti Bamleshwari Mata Rani Temple - Located at ground level, it's the alternative temple for devotees who cannot climb the hill, also very popular during Navratri.

name: Gangrel Dam (Ravishankar Sagar Dam)
description: Gangrel Dam (Ravishankar Sagar Dam)- One of the largest dams in Chhattisgarh, built on the Mahanadi River, offering scenic views, water sports, and a serene reservoir perfect for picnics and sunsets.

name: Sihawa Hill
description: Sihawa Hill -

name: Jabarra Forest
description: Jabarra Forest - A dense forest area rich in biodiversity, ideal for eco-tourism and a peaceful retreat for nature lovers and bird watchers.

name: Nandan Van Zoo & Safari
description: Nandan Van Zoo & Safari - A modern zoological park with safari rides offering a close view of tigers, lions, bears, and more in natural habitats.

name: MM Fun City
description: MM Fun City - A popular water park and amusement zone for families and kids offering slides, wave pools, and entertainment.

name: Kevalya Dham Jain Temple
description: Kevalya Dham Jain Temple -

name: Mainpat
description: Mainpat - Often called the 'Shimla of Chhattisgarh', Mainpat is a beautiful hill station known for its Tibetan settlements, rolling meadows, and cool climate.

name: Fish Point (Tiger Point)
description: Fish Point (Tiger Point) - A scenic spot in Mainpat offering breathtaking valley views and misty cliffs, popular for its peaceful environment and picnic vibes.

name: Mehta Point
description: Mehta Point - A panoramic viewpoint in Mainpat that gives a sweeping view of the dense forests and undulating hills — a photographer’s delight.

name: Semarsot Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Semarsot Wildlife Sanctuary - A sanctuary known for its dry deciduous forest and a variety of wildlife including leopards, bears, and many bird species.

name: Maheshpur Waterfall
description:
Maheshpur Waterfall
A hidden gem near Ambikapur, this waterfall is surrounded by dense greenery and is ideal for offbeat nature explorers

name: Chaiturgarh Fort (Lafagarh)
description: Chaiturgarh Fort (Lafagarh) - A majestic hilltop fort known for its historical significance and natural beauty. The fort area includes caves and temples, accessible via a scenic trek.

name: Devapahari Waterfall
description: Devapahari Waterfall

name: Jain Temple, Dongargarh
description: Jain Temple, Dongargarh - A peaceful and intricately built Jain temple dedicated to Lord Shantinath, attracting both devotees and architecture lovers.

name: Anthropological Museum, Jagdalpur
description:
Anthropological Museum, Jagdalpur - 
Showcases the diverse tribal culture of Bastar, including tools, art, jewelry, and daily life artifacts.
